intro: Graffenrieda denticulata, commonly known as the toothed graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have finely toothed margins, giving it its common name. Graffenrieda denticulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
